job_description:
Advarra provides integrated solutions that safeguard trial participants, empower clinical sites, ensure compliance, and optimize research performance. Connecting the clinical research ecosystem, Advarra delivers solutions through a site-centric approach that unifies and accelerates the drug development lifecycle, making clinical trials safer, smarter, and faster.

General Summary:

As a Senior Software Test Automation Engineer, you will be involved from the ground up on building and maintaining requirement driven test scenarios, cases, and plans to ensure quality software releases. Furthermore, you will collaborate with the Software Test Engineering team to improve the overall all internal quality system and assisting in internal/external quality audits. You will work integrally with product line management, project managers, support, and developers to ensure a quality driven product.

Principal Duties & Responsibilities
Provide mentorship to team members for best practices and code review
Multi-task daily activities with offline projects
Assist in maintaining and modernizing automation framework
Drive initiatives for software quality process efficiency and improvements
Design, document, execute, and maintain test plans, scenarios, use cases, scripts and procedures
Design, execute, and maintain automated test scripts
Assist in CRM/File Share administration
Ensure full lifecycle testing including: integration, regression, and stress tests
Document software defects using the company’s CRM tracking system
Provide input on functional requirements and potential problems
Find and report defects to software developers
Help investigate customer problems as needed
Perform other job-related duties as assigned.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or Computer Science preferred, or equivalent relevant experience.

Experience:
7+ years of related experience, passionate about quality assurance.
5+ years of automated testing experience, including building and maintaining automation testing solutions for frontend UI and backend API.
Experience with version control and issue tracking

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
Proficient in C#/Selenium
Proficient in one or more of the following testing tools:
GitHub (Git), SQL, Playwright, Nunit, Junit, Taurus, JMeter, Postman, Appium.
Working knowledge of relational database concepts
Knowledge of healthcare and clinical trial industry standards and regulations
Methodical and thorough approach to problem troubleshooting and solving
Sound interpersonal, communication, writing and presentation skills
Aptitude to think more widely about the context of work and broader interdependencies
Ability to organize, coordinate and prioritize day to day workload
Motivated by quality achievement
Ability to work in a cross-functional team and independently with strong interpersonal skill
At ease in a mid-size company environment that blends rigorous management with an entrepreneurial culture
Strong fundamentals with SDLC methodologies (Agile, waterfall)

Physical and Mental Requirements:
Sit or stand for extended periods of time at stationary workstation.
Regularly carry, raise, and lower objects of up to 25 Lbs.
Learn and comprehend basic instructions.
Focus and attention to tasks and responsibilities.
Verbal communication; listening and understanding, responding, and speaking.
